intro: Cyathocalyx scortechinii, commonly known as the narrowleaf cyathocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Cyathocalyx scortechinii is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
